awd_titl_txt: Modeling Seasonal and Interannual Variability of the        Wind-Driven Circulation in the Indo-Pacific region
awd_abstract_narration: This grant is to model the influence of the Indonesian                  throughflow on the life cycle of El Nino - Southern Oscillation                 events. The Pacific discharges a net flow (of still undetermined                amount) of warm, low salinity water into the Indian Ocean.                      Superimposed on this flow there is an annual flux and reflux of                 water driven by the seasonal monsoons. Every few years, the warm                water accumulating in the Western Pacific sloshes back into the                 eastern equatorial region producing an El Nino. This work will                  elucidate the role of the semi-permeable boundary formed by the                 Indonesian Archipelago in maintaining the balance of water in and               out of the Western Equatorial Pacific.
